text: Inhibition of nuclear factor kappa B subunit <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA accumulation in lipopolysaccharide - stimulated human monocytic cells treated with sodium salicylate .

Lipopolysaccharide is one of the most potent trigger substances for monocytes and macrophages causing secretion of inflammatory mediators such as tumor necrosis factor and <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The nature of the nuclear factors involved in regulation of these cytokine genes is still unknown .

Nuclear factor kappa B ( NF-kappa B ; heterodimer of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) proteins have been suggested to play an important role in gene transcription of inflammatory mediators when monocytes are stimulated with lipopolysaccharide .
Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs such as salicylates have been used to treat symptoms of inflammation , and a new mechanism of drug action was suggested recently .

Salicylates have been shown to inhibit lipopolysaccharide - induced gene transcription via inhibition of NF-kappa B activation by preventing the degradation of NF-kappa B inhibitor " <extra_id_0> I kappa B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> " , blocking the translocation of NF-kappa B into the nuclear compartment .
However , the nature of the subunit involved in this mechanism has not been defined .

To examine the mechanisms by which salicylates affect cytokine gene transcription , the amount of active and inactive NF-kappa B and NF-kappa B mRNA , in Porphyromonas gingivalis lipopolysaccharide - stimulated human monocytic cells was assessed .

High doses of sodium salicylate suppressed NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA accumulation , resulting in suppression of total NF-kappa B , <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on tissue oligonucleotide had no effects on lipopolysaccharide - induced NF-kappa B activation .

The data demonstrate that the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit of NF-kappa B is inhibited by salicylate treatment and highlight the role of salicylate in the control of gene expression of inflammatory mediators .
